intro: Deilosma kladnii, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in sandy, coastal soils. It is often found in moist, well-drained areas along the coast. Deilosma kladnii is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems.
